Description: Fragment of round handle at neck join from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; dull cream surface. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) nos 517, 611; our stamp may well have read Pop on the left, as does the latter. However the two P are not the same shape, as far as can be discerned. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 56, 3 is almost certainly the same piece, with the punctuation taken as the tail of a Q.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1295)
